meanings.definition: Easily disturbed or drawn away from what one is doing
meanings.sent1: The distractible child couldn't finish his homework because he kept looking out the window.
meanings.sent2: She is distractible during class and often misses important information.
meanings.sent3: The distractible puppy chased after every leaf that blew by.
meanings.sent4: His distractible mind wandered like a lost balloon in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The distractible squirrel forgot where it buried its nuts within minutes.

meanings.definition: Prone to being easily diverted or losing focus
meanings.sent1: The distractible student found it hard to concentrate on the test with all the noise outside.
meanings.sent2: Being distractible in a busy office can make it challenging to complete tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The distractible cat kept chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her distractible thoughts fluttered around her head like butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The distractible bee buzzed from flower to flower, unable to settle on just one.
